title: NITTYGRITTY (NEW MEDIA)
description: YouTube style apps are constantly censoring content creators by deleting their video or demonetizing them.

f6_assessments.q0: As an avid internet user, I can confirm that the general sentiment is a direction of safeguarding the internet as 'the last free medium'. So providing a service for raw and uncut video material fits well in this overall sentiment. Integrating that into a blockchain would be the logical next step in online evolution. To further improve on this idea, it is advisable to provide a plan that describes progress in a prospected timeframe.
f6_assessments.q1: Since there is a high demand and a call against online censorship, the project would gain a lot of traction. It would have been nice to see some details about the team's experience. The requested fund is a lot and there is no explanation given as to why it would be this amount.
f6_assessments.q2:
The plan and roadmap are not very detailed. There is also no justification of the requested funding amount. A team is mentioned, but not how many team members. The experience is a bit vague. 
The idea is good, but it needs to be worked out more in detail to make this proposal top notch. 
Some good advice to gain traction is to add how you would make this somehow competitive against already existing platforms.

f6_assessments.q0: No mention of how NFTs will work in this project.  A project like this has serious competition. It will take something extremely disruptive to drive YouTube traffic to a new platform. If NFTs were involved in this project it would already create more traffic and have an impact on  Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: No evidence provided of team's experience and size of the team. Providing profile links, github pages or links to past projects your team worked on will boost voter confidence in your capabilities in making this project a reality. The budget is a bit high and it's very unclear how it will be used.
f6_assessments.q2: No clear roadmap and milestones with key performance indicators provided. Only indicated that design and development will take 4 - 6 months. The solution to the YouTube problem isn't clearly defined. There is a problem and it needs to be solved. A problem like that needs a team with the relevant experience and a robust plan.  There is a mountain of challenges and risks that needs to be considered and addressed. It is doable, but you need an A-team for a project like this. Experts in the field.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this project should be in the DApps and Integrations sections. I do not understand how NFTs fit in this business model. I would like to see the problem statement refined to explain the value the project will bring to the Cardano ecosystem. I would like the team to adress challenges like content control at scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has been proactive by securing the top level domain for NittyGritty. However, the project requires further development. I would want to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". Furthermore, the project must develop the budget and breakdown the budget into identifiable items. Lastly, the team can provide a deeper explanation about the architecture and language for the implementation of the back end – servers, hosting, support etc.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided proposal provides a rough 4-6 month roadmap and single line budget. I would like to see the team develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – what does success look like in 6 to 9 months, how many content creators do you want on the platform by month 6 – set a goal and use it as a KPI.  Furthermore, I would like to see the team enhance the roadmap, develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, for example, set milestones for creating the wallet, signing content creators, capture users, record views, etc. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has a lot to do with the "DApps and integrations" challenge, but not with the challenge it was introduced to. At no time do the authors mention the use of NFT in their DApp. It's a good idea, really relevant, because in fact youtube censors a lot of content, creating a new video platform that is more open in this sense can be beneficial for many users. What worries me here is how this content freedom would be done, because certain things do need to be censored, such as: adult content (if the DApp is open to any user, it is inappropriate for minors to have access to this type of content); content that is morally offensive to any group, and so on. I think the lack of censorship needs to be thought about, an idea I had is: the user would need to prove their age to access the DApp (it could even an Atala Prism ID when it was launched!). Anyway, it's an interesting idea, but it doesn't involve the use of NFT, as the challenge calls for. Another issue is that I didn't quite understand how the profit involved here would be, how the content creators would monetize the videos (perhaps the views are paid?), how the advertising content would be managed and so on.
f6_assessments.q1: There are no details regarding the authors' team. All we know is that they have 15 years of experience in app design and management/development. But it would be important for us to know who they are, their names, what each one does (who are the designers? and the developers?), how many people make up the team and also some examples of apps they have developed so far. Without such information, there is no assurance regarding your ability to successfully develop the project. As far as a roadmap is concerned, we basically don't know anything about how the DApp would be developed, just how long this development would take, thus making the visualization of the project's future very uncertain.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, what we see in this proposal is something even common to find in the description of proposals for the funds. The authors use a lot of space to detail what the DApp would look like, but they don't explain anything about its build process. We would need to know which phases would make up this trajectory, and within each phase what would happen, with dates, the professionals involved in each step, who would do what and for how long, metrics to measure the project's success (so that the Cardano community could follow the course of things). All we know is how long this DApp would take to develop. It would also be necessary to establish a dissemination plan for the DApp, after all, youtube is one of the most famous and used apps around the world, creating a competitor for it would need a strong promotion. For these reasons, I believe that project auditability needs to be reformulated.

solution: Decentralized, Raw and Uncut New Media. Articulate opinions and ideas through fully censorship-resistant and direct video monotization.💰
experience: My team has fifteen years experience in design and applications management and development.
